fields.description:
h2. Problem Statement

Disable the following modules slow down Jira application restart.
 * Atlassian Hipchat Integration Plugin
 * Atlassian Hipchat Integration Plugin Core

(!) If you have the parameter {{-Datlassian.plugins.enable.wait=300}} defined in your Java argument, the application restart will take at least 300 seconds.
h2. Expected Behavior

Jira restart skips the initialization of the HipChat integration modules.
h2. Actual Behavior

Jira tries to initialize the HipChat integration modules until it timeouts.
h2. Workaround

If you're looking to disable HipChat plugin, all you need is to disable the following plugin.
 * HipChat for Jira

Keep the following plugins enabled to avoid long application restart.
 * Atlassian Hipchat Integration Plugin
 * Atlassian Hipchat Integration Plugin Core

(i) Update: KB article created instead: https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/disable-hipchat-integration-plugin-slows-down-application-restart-941590920.html
fields.summary: Disable HipChat Integration Plugin slows down application restart

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After a screen is associated with a screen on a transition that has a workflow validator on it, a user that does not satisfy the validator can attach attachments into the screen and attempt to transition the issue, the transition will not go through due to the validator but the attachments are still attached.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have 2 users in your JIRA Instnace (eg. Admin and User)
# Ensure that the Admin has the *Administer Projects* permission and the User does not.
# Associate a screen to a workflow transition and ensure that it has the "Attachments" field on it.
# Add a workflow validator for the workflow transition:  'Only users with Administer Projects permission can execute this transition'
# Using the User account, attempt to perform the transition.
# Attach some new attachments into the Attachments field in the screen that appears.
# Try to execute the transition.

h3. Expected Results
The transition will fail to execute due to the validator and after cancelling the transition, the attachments will not be attached into the issue.

h3. Actual Results
The transition will still fail to execute but all attached attachments are now added into the issue after the transition is cancelled.

h3. Notes
If you attached the attachments into the screen and canceled the transition without executing the transition, the attachments will not be attached into the issue.

h3.Workaround
Manually deleting the attachments if they aren't wanted.
fields.summary: Attachments still get attached if the transition fails due to the validators.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA health-check UI pop-up reports Lucene error while index is healthy. This is false positive. 
Possible reason: scheduled health-check which at some point in time failed is still believe there is an inconsistency.  

h3. Steps to Reproduce
This is one of ways to expose the problem
# Stop JIRA
# Delete JIRA index 
# Start JIRA
# Navigate to JIRA as a admin and observe the Lucene health-check warning 
# Run Full reindex after some delay
# Navigate to JIRA as a admin again 

h3. Expected Results
Health-check doesn't show warning. 

h3. Actual Results
* Health-check shows warning: _The Lucene health check has failed in your system._
 !Lucene_error.png|thumbnail! 
 * If you go to* Support Tools* > Instance health checks, it shows OK (/)
** Success - Lucene
{noformat}
Result

The check of the database and the index is ok. The database had 10,051 issues with the most recent update at 12/4/17 10:28 AM and the index had 10,051 issues with the most recent update at 12/4/17 10:28 AM.
{noformat}


h3. Notes
Data from {{AO_88263F_HEALTH_CHECK_STATUS}} table:
{noformat}
select * from "AO_88263F_HEALTH_CHECK_STATUS";

 APPLICATION_NAME |                                COMPLETE_KEY                                 |                              DESCRIPTION                              |       FAILED_DATE       |                                                   FAILURE_REASON                                                    | ID | IS_HEALTHY | IS_RESOLVED |      RESOLVED_DATE      | SEVERITY | STATUS_NAME
------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+----+------------+-------------+-------------------------+----------+-------------
 JIRA             | com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-healthcheck-plugin:luceneSupportHealthCheck | Checks the state of the search index is consistent with the database. | 2017-12-04 10:40:38.676 | The issue index is inconsistent with the database state. Database has (10,051) issues but the index has (0) issues. | 19 | t          | t           | 2017-12-04 10:41:48.579 | MAJOR    | Lucene
 JIRA             | com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-healthcheck-plugin:luceneSupportHealthCheck | Checks the state of the search index is consistent with the database. | 2017-12-04 10:41:49.109 | The issue index is inconsistent with the database state. Database has (10,051) issues but the index has (0) issues. | 20 | t          | t           | 2017-12-04 11:48:40.989 | MAJOR    | Lucene
{noformat}

h3.Workaround
Double check the Lucene status, if it's ok, you can safely ignore the error.
fields.summary: JIRA health-check reports Lucene error while index is healthy

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When you have a user already exist under Delegated LDAP in JIRA, JIRA still allow you to create the same username in JIRA under JIRA internal directory.

h3. Environment
JIRA 7.6.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have 2 user directory (1 JIRA internal directory and the other Delegated LDAP, in this case directory order doesn't matter)
# Have the user from Delegated LDAP into JIRA
# So now the user show up in JIRA under Delegated LDAP in JIRA, we called it userA
# Go to Create Users in JIRA, then create the same username, userA under JIRA internal directory

h3. Actual Results
It allows you to create the same username without any issue, and the now userA in JIRA is showing under JIRA internal directory instead of Delegated LDAP.

h3. Expected Improvement
It should throw an error message to prevent the same username to be created in JIRA internal directory

h3. Notes
When you try to rename the latest username you had just created to a different username, it will transfer all history of the older user account to the newer user account as this will caused unnecessary hassle to the affected user.
fields.summary: JIRA allow the same username to be created in the internal directory itself when the same username already exist in in the delegated LDAP

fields.description:
h3. Summary
AWS Template for Jira Data Center will perform a recursive {{chown}} on the Shared Home directory on launch. For {{data}} directory that is very large will have this command take a long time (40min+) to complete.

h3. Environment
* AWS Template Jira Data Center 
* Attachments data of 1TB+

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Launch the second node JDC using AWS Template
# Wait until it running the {{chown}} command

h3. Expected Results
Skip the {{chown}} command if the data already exist with the right user permission

h3. Actual Results
{{chown -R -H}} command takes 40+ minutes
{code:borderStyle=dashed}
root     17610  2866  0 02:54 ?        00:00:59 chown -R -H jira:jira /media/atl/jira/shared
{code}
 
h3.Workaround
Use a custom AWS template to exclude the {{chown}} on launching the second node
* AWS template - https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/atlassian-aws-deployment/downloads/
fields.summary: Jira Data Center AWS Template chown can be slow on large data

fields.description:
h3. +Issue description+

The plugin checker complains that this plugin is incompatible with JIRA 7.6.0, although it is

h3. +Steps to reproduce+

- Install JIRA 7.5.1 (or any JIRA version between 7.4.3 and 7.5.3)
- Go to JIRA Admin > Add-ons > Manage add-ons
- Look for the add-on "Troubleshooting and Support - Jira"
- Upgrade it to 1.6.1
- Click on "JIRA update check" and select 7.6.0


h3. +Expected Result+

The update checker should not be complaining about the plugin "Troubleshooting and Support - Jira", since it's compatible with JIRA 7.6.0 and bundled with it.

h3. +Actual Result+

Since the compatibility of this plugin is not up to date on the [Atlassian Marketplace|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.troubleshooting.plugin-jira/server/overview] (it only shows as compatible until JIRA 7.5.3), the plugin checker thinks that this plugin will be incompatible with JIRA 7.6.0, as shown in the screenshot below:
 !PluginCompatibilityCheck.png|thumbnail! 

h3. +Suggested solution+

The list of compatible JIRA versions should be updated on Atlassian Marketplace.

h3. +Workaround+

Ignore the plugin compatibility message from the update checker.
fields.summary: Plugin compatibility check is giving an error when testing the system plugin "Troubleshooting and Support - Jira"

fields.description:
h5. Problem Definition
At the moment, the time tracking is being calculated within the issue itself. So if you log the work in a subtask, then it'll only be calculated against the original and remaining estimation of the subtask itself. The parent issue will have its own time tracking record.

h5. Suggested Solution
It would be great to have the option to do cross calculation where it allows the original estimation set in parents and time spent/log work entered in subtasks. The remaining estimation is then shown in parents by subtracting the original estimation (set in parents) with time spent (entered in sub-task)

In the use case where the team works on subtasks, and not parent issue, this is helpful allow the time spent entered in sub-tasks to be calculated against parents estimation.
fields.summary: Having the option to do cross calculation against parent and sub task issue

fields.description:
The rest service calls
 # /issue/\{idOrKey}/?expand=renderedFields&fields=worklog
 # /issue/\{idOrKey}/worklogs

do not provide this.

Call 1. only delivers the first 20 worklogs and does not seem to support pagination

Call 2. delivers them all, but does not have an option to have the wiki-markup rendered as HTML

So either make call 1 have a workLogStartAt Parameter or have call 2 support the expand=renderedFields parameter.

 

Right now for Jira Cloud i don't know of a way to get worklog comments rendered, for server one would have to implement a service in Java.

A javascript based wiki renderer would help too.
fields.summary: Provide a way to get all worklog comments rendered on the client side

fields.description:
At this moment, JIRA does not offer an option to have a fine control of when issues can be converted to or from subtask.
Since this conversion is not considered a move operation, restricting this permission through the permission scheme or through workflow properties does not prevent a user from converting an issue to a sub-task or vice-versa. Preventing the issue from being edited also does not work as well.

We understand that this suggestion was already denied in the past (JRASERVER-15124) due to 'configuration complexity' , but we believe that this should be reconsidered as the foundation for this feature is already somewhat present in the system (for instance, make the conversion be considered a move operation, allowing it to be controlled by workflow properties).

Also, after the implementation of JRASERVER-13245 this is more important as we're only allowed to use the bulk operation to link the subtask to a parent, but when doing that through the "More" menu we don't have this option.
fields.summary: Allow finer control of converting to/from subtasks

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Visual / Text editor options can become locked out and unselectable until page is refreshed


h3. Environment
Jira Server 7.6.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open an issue in Jira
# Click the Comment button
# Select the "TEXT" option in the editor itself
# Refresh the browser page
# Return to add a new comment once more
# Click the "TEXT" option again at the bottom of the comment window

h3. Expected Results
Nothing should happen, the session has already selected Text as the editor mode.


h3. Actual Results
The options for both Visual and Text become immediately greyed out and unselectable on the page.
Only way to revert this is to refresh the page.  At which point you can then select which ever mode you want again correctly.
 
h3. Notes


h3.Workaround
Refresh the page
fields.summary: Visual / Text editor options can become locked out and unselectable until page is refreshed
Security review of outgoing requests

fields.description:
h3.Summary

Some gadgets e.g. 'Two-dimensional Filters Statistics' use a 'Saved Filter' select to specify a particular filter for configuration. Others, such as 'Created vs. Resolved chart' use 'Project or Saved Filter' select for a similar purpose. These selects do not always work optimally - autocomplete fails to suggest the filter that fits the string typed in best.

h3.Steps to Reproduce
 # Create the following filters (I suggest these to be the only filters present as a different dataset may lead to different results)
 ** My Triage AAA
 ** My Triage BBB
 ** My Triage CCC
 ** My Triage DDD
 ** My Triage EEE
 ** My Triage FFF
 ** My Triage GGG
 ** My Triage HHH
 ** My Triage III
 ** My Triage JJJ
 ** My Triage KProblem

Once the filters have been created:

 # Add a 'Two-dimensional Filters Statistics' gadget to a dashboard.
 # Edit gadget's configuration and type in 'My Triage KP' in 'Saved filter' quick search.

h3.Expected Results

Autocomplete suggests 'My Triage KProblem' filter as it fits the typed in input.

h3.Actual Results

Autocomplete says 'No matches'. One has to type in the full name 'My Triage KProblem' to be able to select it.

!Screen Shot 2017-11-28 at 15.25.27.png|thumbnail!

!Screen Shot 2017-11-28 at 15.25.33.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
There is no consistent workaround; however, filters can be renamed; or searched for with different terms. In the example above, searching for *KProblem* will return the correct filter.

Alternatively, use the advanced search dialog to find the correct filter.

h3.Notes
* When clicking into the dialog box, a REST call is made {{$jira-url/rest/gadget/1.0/pickers/filters?fieldName=quickfind&query=}} - this is  an empty query which finds 10 saved filters (ordered alphabetically).
* Typing letters into the box does a quick search based on that query - for example, typing "M" with the above data set produces a request to {{$jira-url/rest/gadget/1.0/pickers/filters?fieldName=quickfind&query=M}}.
* In each case, only the top 10 rows are returned, sorted alphabetically
fields.summary: Saved Filter and Project or Saved Filter in gadgets don't suggest best fit filters in autocomplete

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
_Standalone_ Jira and _Local cache_ for JIRA Datacenter use Guava local cache, which is configured to the default of +4 segments+. This means the recency queue (hypothetical contention point) supports concurrency level of 4. In case of large cache and large installations (24+ Cores), increasing the segment count will increase CPU efficiency.

h3. Suggested Solution
Increase number of segments 

h3. Workaround 
None
fields.summary: Increase number of cache segment for local cache

fields.description:

If yes, could you give us all details about version and updates.

The Jira infrastructure is :

Jira 7.3.7 on a Windows server 2012 R2 system.

Apache Tomcat/8.5.6

SQL Server 2014 (JTDS  4)

Thanks in advance for your answer.

Regards,
fields.summary: SUN One Application and JIRA Server

fields.description: Add mechanism to Jira Data Center that would detect cache replication failures to particular node. In case such failures are detected the offending node is excluded from replication for certain period of time. After that period Jira will retry replication to that node if that fail backoff period should increase exponentially.
fields.summary: Do not replicate caches to node that has problems receiving cache replication requests

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Ehcache does a synchronous replication of invalidations through RMI during cache reset. This in turn happens inside atlassian-caches lock that does not allow any loads to proceed while reset is being processed. That basically mean that gets are blocked by potentially slow RMI replication. 
h3. Environment
 * JIRA datacenter with multiple nodes
*Node A* is unresponsive because of extremely high load or high memory pressure or any other condition that makes it unresponsive. However, at this state node is not technically down and still registered as an 'Active' member in the cluster but not processing request either.
*Node B* still consider node *A* as 'Active' so it keeps performing cache synchronisation to Node A which not responding to the request and put Node B in stale position. 

h3. Expected behaviour

Cache replication happens outside of get/reset lock and is not blocking cache loading.
fields.summary: Remote invalidation of caches is performed in get/reset lock

fields.description:
h3. Description of the problem
At present, linking issue from a transition does not show the option for Server selection. However, linking issues from "More" -> "Link" shows the option for Server selection

 !Feature.PNG|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested changes
Show the option for users to select Server when linking is performed via the transition.
We were wondering if this feature could be implemented so that it would allow more flexibility in linking issues during issue transition.
fields.summary: Allow Linking Issue via Workflow to Select Server

fields.description:
h3. Problem
Jira has UX bug which is tricking users to save empty filter.

Scenario to trigger this bug:
 # Issues -> Search for Issues
 # Type JQL 
 # Click save as and name the filter

h3. Result
Empty filer is saved.

h3. Expected result
Entered filter is saved

h3. Root cause
This is happening because currently executed filter is saved not the one that is entered on the screen. 
We suspect that this bug is creating problems with empty filters as people save them by accident not on purpose. 

h3. Note on fix
User will be able to save an empty filter. We just make user more conscious about what is saved by:
* enabling save button only after search of entered query has been performed
* providing a warning in case an empty filer is about to be saved
* other minor fixes
fields.summary: It is extremely easy to save empty JQL filter

fields.description:
Summary:
Audit log does not record changes to screen if the fields are added/remove via *JIRA Administration > Issues > Custom Fields > cogwheel > Screen > select checkboxes*. The changes are only recorded when the fields are added via *JIRA Administration > Screens > Configure > Add field*. The former should be included in the audit log as well.
fields.summary: Audit log does not record changes to screen if fields are added through Custom Fields > Screens

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Jira Cloud system time is in UTC. Migration from Jira Cloud to Jira Server means a potential different system time. Users _may_ encounter [incorrect times displayed in Jira|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/incorrect-times-displayed-in-jira-148078632.html] after the migration.

h3. Suggested Solution
Update the migration documentation
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/migrating-from-jira-cloud-to-server-applications-938846963.html

To include a workaround for applying JVM parameter {{-Duser.timezone=UTC}} on Step 4 before importing the Cloud data to Jira Server. Once restored, they may remove the JVM parameter.

h3. Why this is important
Users will be seeing wrong display time in all date format values

h3. Notes
The workaround does not work if the JIRA Sever DB is MySQL. In case you use MySQL you need to: 
# Export from the source JIRA Server using MySQL
# Import into a staging JIRA Server with PostgreSQL (configured to have the same timezone as the source JIRA)
# Stop JIRA
# Change the JVM timezone to UTC 
# Start JIRA and export the backup
fields.summary: Update Migration from Cloud to Server documentation to include Timezone details

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-69159].
  {panel}
_as_ a project admin

_I want_ to be able to have more advanced editing capabilities with workflows

_so I_ am not constantly depending on a system admin

 

With project workflows, I want to be able to:
 * edit workflows as text and not only as graphic.
 * edit a transition's properties
 * edit a transition's conditions
 * edit any validators
 * edit any post-functions
 * be able to set the "ops.bar.group.size.opsbar-transitions = X" to adjust buttons issue screen

 

Before 7.3 I was a system admin, but now I was promised that project admin's were more capable to edit workflow's and there were too many system admins in our company that were not system admins. Now I am constantly restricted.
fields.summary: Enable advanced editing workflow Project Admin

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When upgrading, the 'you've just been upgraded!' screen shows the incorrect date of upgrade.  This is showing the date of the last X.X.0 release and not any subsequent patches.  It does show the correct version but the wrong date with that version.



h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Upgrade from any x.x.0 release to a x.x.1 release
# Note the time/date of the upgrade shows the time/date of the .0 release and not the patch.

h3. Expected Results
Page should show the date/time of the latest patch to avoid confusion in regard to the integrity of the upgrade.

h3. Actual Results
Date of the x.x.0 release is shown. In this screen shot the date of 21/Nov/17 4:11 pm is when the 7.5.0 upgrade took placed NOT the 7.5.1 upgrade.
 !7.5.1.png|thumbnail! 
 !database.png|thumbnail! 
Upgrading this to 7.5.3 still shows the 7.5.0 upgrade time/date
 !7.5.3.png|thumbnail! 
It's only when the system is upgraded to 7.6.0 does the time/date change
 !7.6.0.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
It looks like this may have been pulling from the upgradeversionhistory table which is no longer showing x.x.1 releases and is only showing the major 7.5.0 or 7.6.0 upgrades.

h3.Workaround
No workaround.  the upgrade was done correctly even though the time/date shows the wrong upgrade.
fields.summary: You've just been upgraded page shows wrong date for point releases

fields.description:
h3. Summary
{{FilterBean}} has an expandable field {{sharedUsers}}. It calculates total size of this collection even if the field isn't expanded.
It causes unnecessary memory pressure. (i.e. JRASERVER-65930) and extra DB load (i.e. JRASERVER-65892)
Documentation page: [REST-7.6.4-filter-getFavouriteFilters|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/7.6.4/#api/2/filter-getFavouriteFilters]
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Create a filter
* Share it with some user group
* Do REST API call /rest/api/2/filter/favourite

h3. Expected Results
{{sharedUsers}} have {{size=0}}

h3. Actual Results
{{sharedUsers}} have calculated size

h3.Workaround
*  Set dark feature {{com.atlassian.jira.rest.v2.search.UserListResolver.getShareCount.disabled}} flag, that will always return _sharedUsers.size: 0_ in JSON response, eg:
{noformat}
sharedUsers: {
 size: 0,
 items: [ ],
 max-results: 1000,
 start-index: 0,
 end-index: 0
},
{noformat}
*- (!) API break. Since after change {{/rest/api/2/filter/favourite}} API doesn't return a correct number of the share count there is a risk that it will affect some other functionality. 

h3.Details on fix
* *Implementation*: 
** {{/rest/api/2/filter/favourite}} API doesn't  return size of sharedUsers collection, when it is not expanded (default)
** {{enableSharedUsers}} parameters is removed. Previous description: _enableSharedUsers_ (boolean) Default: true - enable calculating shared users collection
* *Reasoning*: Such behavior was never described in the API, so it's not breakage.
* If you were relying on this behaviour, you need to adapt your code: you need to expand sharedUsers in your request. 
** I.e.: <jira_url>/rest/api/2/filter/favourite?expand=sharedUsers[0]
fields.summary: FilterBean always calculates number of sharedUsers

fields.description:
Some teams dislike that selecting one or more issues on a Board updates the URL to "follow" that issue around, for example clicking an issue on:

https://jira.wherever.com/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=1234\\ 
And the link changes:

https://jira.wherever.com/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=1234&selectedIssue=ABC-100\\ 
Then, while moving around the board, the view will update to wherever that issue is, even if actions are being taken elsewhere (ranking issues, etc).

We'd like to see some sort of toggle that can be used to disable this "following" effect, so selecting issues on the Board does not continuously impact the view while taking actions unrelated to that issue. Thanks!
{quote}
fields.summary: Option to disable direct issue in URL for Boards

h4. Summary
Editing time tracking with fractional value results in indefinite spin

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Lets say working day is 8 hours
# Access view issue page > type g + g + time tracking
# Enter original estimate as 0.76d
# Click Submit

h4. Expected Result 
It will accept the value and show original estimate as 6h 4m 48s

h4. Actual Result
It will keep spinning indefinitely

h4. Note
* The functions seems to be broken if the value has fractional minute. 
* So for example, if the value is 0.825d which is equal to 6h and 36 mins, it will accept the value
* If the value is equal to 6 hours 4 mins 48 seconds, it does not accept the value
fields.summary: Editing time tracking with fractional value results in indefinite spin

fields.description:
h3. Problem:
In cases where we need to modify an erroneous workflow name, it is advisable to create a copy of that workflow with the correct name and associate that copy of the workflow to the existing workflow scheme. However, if the workflow scheme has a multiple workflows on it, you won't be able to publish it without going through the status mapping page. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# Create a 3 different workflows and associate to 3 different issue type
# Associate the workflows to a single workflow scheme and assign it to a project
!1.png|thumbnail!
!2.png|thumbnail!
# Copy the 'ABC Bug' workflow
# Go to Project > Project Settings > Workflows and click on the Workflow Scheme in use
# Click on Add Workflow > Add Existing and select the Copy of 'ABC Bug' workflow
!3.png|thumbnail!
# Choose Bug and click Finish
!4.png|thumbnail!
# Publish the changes

Expected Behaviour
The workflow will be associated without any issue and the issues will be migrated to the copy of the workflow

Actual Behaviour
A status mapping page is displayed
!5.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Workflow Scheme with multiple Workflows shows a Status Mapping page when Publishing

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In Jira Data Center during cache replication value of ehcache.listener.socketTimeoutMillis from clustered.properties (or a default value) should be used as read timeout for remote RMI calls to other nodes in cluster. Instead an infinity is used. Problems with communication with one node can bring entire cluster down.
h3. Environment
 * JIRA datacenter with multiple nodes
*Node A* is unresponsive because of extremely high load or high memory pressure or any other condition that makes it unresponsive. However, at this state node is not technically down and still registered as an 'Active' member in the cluster but not processing request either.
*Node B* still consider node *A* as 'Active' so it keeps performing cache synchronisation to Node A which not responding to the request and put Node B in stale position. 

h3. Symptoms

 
h3. Expected behaviour
TCP and RMI handshakes will throw an exception after the specified timeout has passed.  

h3. Workarounds
Restart or gracefully shutdown the unresponsive node.

h3. Note on fix 
It makes EhCache replication use finite (default *5s*) timeouts for TCP and RMI handshakes during cache replication.
fields.summary: ehcache.listener.socketTimeoutMillis is not used for TCP/RMI handshakes

fields.description: One of our clients wanted to use issue-level security, but were turned off from it because if you set it for an Epic, the underlying stories don't inherit it. (only sub-tasks)
fields.summary: Allow stories to inherit Epic issue-level security

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When dragging an attachment to an issue, a comment to that attachment will not be added if the comment box is open and in visual mode.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click in the Comment box, to allow input
 # Ensure the visual editor is enabled and selected
 # Drag an attachment to the issue

h3. Expected Results
The comment is updated with a wiki formatted link to the attachment.

h3. Actual Results
The comment is not updated with a wiki formatted link to the attachment. There are no visible errors in the log, or in the console.

h3. Tested Scenarios
 * Without the comment box active: Comment is added automatically with a link
 * With comment box active, but in text mode: Link is added to the comment box at the insertion point
 * With comment box active, but in visual mode: Link is not added

h3. Workaround
 * Use the text mode before dragging attachments
 * Disable the visual editor
 * Insert the attachment manually from the editor box
fields.summary: When dragging an attachment to an issue, a comment will not be added to the issue if the comment editor is open, and in visual mode

fields.description:
I am interested in a tool that will allow for configuration migrations between a test and production instance of Jira.  The migration tool should support both Jira Core and Jira Service Desk.

There are currently plug-ins that do this in the market place, but it seems like a tool that should be included in the licensing of the Jira product.

One example of a plugin is as follows: [https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.botronsoft.jira.configurationmanager/server/overview]

 

Is there any plan now or in the future to build something like this into the Jira core?

fields.description:
There are several types of calculated misc custom fields, like:
* Calculated Number Field
* Calculated Text Field 
* Calculated Date/Time Field
* Transition Date/Time Field
* Transition Caller Field
* Transition Count Field 

And though all of them are calculated and user cannot edit the value manually, some of them are visible on UI (like "Calculated Number Field"), others are not (like "Transition Caller Field"), and user doesn't control their appearance.

Some of these fields are very helpful for reporting purposes, but they are not necessarily needed/wanted on issue details view. So having ability to hide them on UI while keeping them active is advisable.

----
Additionally, "Hide/Show" option in field configuration actually works more like "Deactivate/Activate", which is confusing, because "hiding" something should not make it inactive, it should only make it invisible, so naming is unfortunate and misleading.
fields.summary: Add ability to hide calculated custom field from UI only but keep it on the background

h3. Summary
Even if the instance is configured with delegated authentication to LDAP, when inviting users to sign up to Jira, they receive an email to set Full Name, Username and Password, even if the password will be set automatically by the LDAP directory later on.

h3. Workaround
There is no workaround currently as it's not possible to customise anything on the invite on the latest Jira Server versions. Its not even possible to add a customised message with instructions.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Atlassian Troubleshooting and Support Tools plugin generates a File Not Found error in Windows Environments

h3. Environment
Windows Server 2012 R2 and Jira 7.5.1 using both the Atlassian Troubleshooting and Support Tools plugin version 1.6.0 and 1.6.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Generate a Support Zip under *System > Troubleshooting and Support Tools > Create Support Zip*.
# Attempt to Download the Zip file with the *Download Zip* button once the file has been created.

h3. Expected Results

You can download the Support Zip without any error.

h3. Actual Results
You receive a 'File not found. The requested file cannot be found on the server' in a Windows Environment

h3.Workaround

You can still find the file downloaded on the server in the {{JIRA\export}} file path.
fields.summary: Atlassian Troubleshooting and Support Tools plugin generates a File Not Found error in Windows Environments

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In Jira you can set a default dashboard to display to your users, and the users can [individually set what their Jira Homepage|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracoreserver/managing-your-user-profile-939937934.html#Managingyouruserprofile-Choosingyourhomepage] should be, from the following:
* Dashboard
* Issue Navigator
* Rapid Board (available if you're using JIRA Software)

(!) Note: the rapid board option only displays the last viewed board

It is not possible to set a default homepage for all users, other than the option to set a default dashboard.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide the ability to set a Jira homepage for all users other than using a dashboard, such as issue navigator (specific filter), or a specific Kanban/Scrum board.
fields.summary: As an admin, ability to set a default Jira homepage other than a dashboard

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition:
# If the log analyzer is having an issue when processing the logs, it will show an error like below without any information.
{code} We couldn't run the log analyzer. There was a problem running the log analyzer. You could try again by clicking Scan. {code}
# Looking at the logs first time would not show anything due to the bug below where the logging is not enabled by default:
#- https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-65278

This causes unnecessary time to take investigate what could be the cause of the log analyzer to fail in scanning the logs.

h3. Suggested Solution:
To give out more information rather than just an Error banner like above.

For example, the feature requires a connection to "confluence.atlassian.com" and it will throw the same error like above when it unable to. To give out a simple message like below will be informative:
{code}The Log Analyzer requires the connection to https://confluence.atlassian.com, please check if JIRA is connected to the internet{code}
OR
{code}Unable to reach https://confluence.atlassian.com {code}
fields.summary: Log Analyzer to show more details if failed

fields.description:
h3. Summary
ProjectRoleActors cache uses _expireAfterAccess_ setting. This means that internal guava cache implementation will maintain recency queue with elements for each read of this cache. This leads to performance problem at large instances as frequently accessed caches might generate more entries to recency queue that can be processed by the system.

h3. Environment
* Large standalone JIRA instance: 
** 1M issues
**  1k projects
** 20k+ users  and different permission settings for projects

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Generate high load on a page that does a lot of project role actors checks either Browse Projects, Browse Boards or a board with issues from different projects (at least 1000 projects).


h3. Expected Results
The load on the cache does not affect Jira performance.

h3. Actual Results
JIRA very slow and doesn't respond. High number of concurrent running threads, very high load average (100+), incoming http threads busy processing recency queue.

h3. Notes
Thread dump will show large number of threads in this code: Cache - com.google.common.cache.LocalCache.get
{noformat}
 42.79% \ at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache.get
 42.11%  \ at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$Segment.get
 41.88%   \ at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$Segment.recordRead
 41.88%    \ at java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentLinkedQueue.add
 41.88%     V at java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentLinkedQueue.offer
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
None known.
fields.summary: JIRA becomes unresponsive because of growing recency queue in frequently used projectRoleActors cache.

fields.description:
Customer raised a community issue in regards to this page:
 [https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver075/jira-applications-installation-requirements-935390824.html]

The focus here is the Server side installation requirements for production section which reads:
{quote} 
 * For a small number of projects (less or equal to 100) with 1,000 to 5,000 issues in total and about 100-200 users, a recent server (multicore CPU) with 2GB of available RAM and a reasonably fast hard drive (7200 rpm or faster) should cater for your needs.

 * For more than 100 projects you should monitor JIRA memory usage and allocate more memory if required.

 * If your system will experience a large number of concurrent requests, running JIRA applications on a multicore CPU machine will increase the concurrency of processing the requests, and therefore, speed up the response time for your users.

 * For reference, we have a server that has a 2 Intel(R) Xeon(R) CPU E5520 @ 2.27GHz (16 logical cores) with 32GB of RAM. This server runs Apache, various monitoring systems, and two JIRA application instances:

 ** Our [public site|https://jira.atlassian.com/] has approximately: 145,000 issues, 255,000 comments, 120 custom fields, and 115 projects. 

 ** Our [support|https://support.atlassian.com/] site has approximately: 285,000 issues, 2,500,000 comments, 75 custom fields, and 22 projects.
{quote}

The values and numbers mentioned here are wildly off what we use in regards to Sizing estimates for customers such as in [JIRA Sizing Guide - Atlassian Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/enterprise/jira-sizing-guide-461504623.html].
The major points I'd like to see addressed are 
# the phrase "with 2GB of available RAM".   The Server itself should just about always have 8GB of dedicated system memory, and Jira's JVM should typically have at least 1GB of xmx assigned to it, even for the smallest installations.     
# Creating 100 projects creates a lot more overhead than this guide implies.  That's because each created project can create new workflows, new custom fields, new permissions schemes, new screens, etc.   
# Also the information in regards to JAC and SAC/GSAC is no longer current and accurate.   I know GSAC is using datacenter deployment now.    I understand if this change might require a separate ticket, but it would be great if we can keep these updated to reflect our current use.
fields.summary: Jira installation requirements are not consistent with our other documentation

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In larger environments with lots of add-ons adding menu items to Jira's navigational menu the header menu can appear blank or the 'More" menu, which appears when the number of items exceeds the browser's width, is missing as depicted below:

 !Screen Shot 2017-11-16 at 2.52.21 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screen Shot 2017-11-16 at 2.52.41 PM.png|thumbnail! 

While this is a transient issue ( happens randomly ) and a browser refresh resolves this problem it can occur multiple times a day for an individual 
 
h3. Environment
* Dozens of add-ons with quite a few adding menu items
 
h3. Notes
Our findings to date:
* the menu initially loads with 0px width 
* JavaScript should set the width to auto 
* In case we don't see the menu, the value of width is not set to auto, and after manually setting it appears. We believe the JavaScript is not executed.
* The menu can load broken even if we see no errors in the console, so nothing obvious breaks it,
*  Both our javascript and dev tools use mutation observers and it's impossible to debug
* So far we only have reports of this occurring in 7.2 and 7.3. A customer was not affected in 7.1 until they upgraded to 7.3

h3.Workaround
Refreshing the browser window resolves this temporarily. 

If refreshing the browser window doesn't solve the issue, use the following announcement banner as a workaround. 
* Click on the *Cog icon* on the upper right corner in Jira, select *System*, Click on Go *Announcement Banner* on the left side, Enter *Edit Announcement Banner* page.
* Paste the following script into the announcement banner page:
{code:java}
    “<script type=“text/javascript”>
jQuery(document).ready(function() {
document.querySelector(“div.aui-header-primary”).querySelectorAll(“ul.aui-nav”).forEach(function(e) { if(e.style.width == 0){ e.style.width = “auto” } })
console.log(“script done”)
});
</script>”
{code}
fields.summary: Race condition causes navigational header to disappear or appear incorrectly

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In JIRA 7.5 the JDBC driver was changed from the JTDS driver to the Microsoft SQL Server driver.  In JTDS there was a workaround to configure it for Active Directory authentication while running on linux:
* [workaround provided by an Atlassian customer|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/setup-windows-based-active-directory-authentication-with-sql-server-720407218.html]

Unfortunately, it looks like the Microsoft JDBC driver does not support domain-based auth when running on Linux:
* [SQL JDBC Integrated Security with Domain Account from Linux - Microsoft Connect|https://connect.microsoft.com/SQLServer/feedback/details/275681/sql-jdbc-integrated-security-with-domain-account-from-linux]

This has led to customers with working JDBC configurations not being able to connect the same way after upgrading to JIRA 7.5+

h3. Suggested Solution
Continue to support JTDS or work with the MS SQL Server driver project on support for domain-based auth.
 
h3. Workaround
# Switch to password-based auth (not fun)
# Go back to the old JTDS driver (not tested and not supported by Atlassian)
# Possibly: implement Kerberos integration as described on [Microsoft's documentation|https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sql/connect/jdbc/using-kerberos-integrated-authentication-to-connect-to-sql-server]
fields.summary: Support Active Directory authentication for SQL Server when running on Linux
Race condition in Jira's top navigational menu causes unexpected behavior

	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748) [?:1.8.0_152]{code}
This makes testing compatibility of plugins for  7.6.0 impossible at the moment. 

This is happening because in dev mode Jira is trying to reload prioritySchemesForPriorityPage.soy file
{code:java}
<resource type="download" name="proritiesPage.soy.js" location="includes/jira/admin/priority-schemes-for-priority/prioritySchemesForPriorityPage.soy">

{code}
location should start with */*includes

*SOLUTION*

This is happening because amps is using Tomcat version 8.0 and Jira is shipped with Tomcat 8.5.

Upgrade to latest Altassian SDK (6.3.4+) and latest AMPS 6.3.6+.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Users are unable to edit Labels when Epic (or other issue) is accessed through filter view.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Use the filter with labels included, eg: labels = Added_to_Scope order by created DESC
 # Click on any of the tickets included in the filter results
 # Attempt to edit the Labels field

h3. Expected Results

Edit icon should appear as usual.
h3. Actual Results

There is no icon appearing to edit and when in Edit there is no field to do so either (see screenshot).
h3. Notes (Optional - If Necessary)

Couldn't reproduce on 7.5.2, reproduced on 7.3.8 and 7.4.2.
h3. Workaround
 # Enter the ticket's URL directly into the address bar of the browser
 # Attempt to edit the Labels field - Icon appears to allow editing the Labels field (Please see attached screenshot for your reference)
fields.summary: Unable to edit labels when Epic accessed through filter view

fields.description:
The [Jira Data Center Performance Metrics|https://confluence.atlassian.com/enterprise/jira-data-center-performance-608960753.html] article states:
{quote}The following tables show the relative performance of the various actions in the tests as the load increases for each JIRA instance configuration: JIRA Server (one node equivalent), two node Data Center, and four node Data Center. Each table shows the response time relative to the baseline response time which we determined to be JIRA Server with six browsers. 
{quote}
However, there is no reference in the entire document to the baseline (one node equivalent) response times, the whole article operates with a percentile compared to that baseline. If I am not mistaken, the response times are specified in the [Jira performance metrics article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver072/jira-performance-metrics-839981964.html]. If this is the case, please make sure to link it accordingly.
fields.summary: Documentation request: JIRA Data Center performance metrics baseline reference missing

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Since 7.5.x, JIRA is shipped with a new JDBC driver for Microsoft SQL Server.

Because of this change, the format of the file dbconfig.xml file needs to be changed manually if a customer upgrades JIRA from a version below 7.5 to 7.5 (for example, the prefix of the database URL is now 'jdbc:sqlserver://').

When the config.bat/config.sh script is run while using a dbconfig.xml file from an older version of JIRA, the script fails to run and gives the following error in the terminal:
{code:java}
Loading application properties from <JIRA_INSTALL>/WEB-INF/classes/jira-application.properties
Reading database configuration from <JIRA_HOME>/dbconfig.xml
No graphics display available; using console.
*** Unable to fully parse the current JDBC settings. Some settings may be blank.
*** Parse Exception: Unable to parse the JDBC URL 'jdbc:jtds:sqlserver:XXXXXXXXXXXXXX'. It should start with protocol prefix 'jdbc:sqlserver://'.
{code}
h3. Why this is important

If the dbconfig.xml file is not properly configured, customers can't connect to the MS SQL database. 
 It can be problematic when a customer upgrades from a version below 7.5 to 7.5, since their dbconfig.xml file will have the old configuration.
h3. Workaround

For now, there is a KB that explains how to update the dbconfig.xml file [Updating JDBC URL for Microsoft SQL Server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/updating-jdbc-url-for-microsoft-sql-server-934718842.html]
h3. Suggested Solution

It would be helpful if the config script could be fixed to automatically update the database URL from the dbconfig.xml (as well as any other change that should be made in this file), if the dbconfig.xml comes from a version before 7.5.x
fields.summary: Fix the config script to update the dbconfig.xml file for the MS SQL database configuration to reflect the changes introduced with JIRA 7.5

fields.description:

Since 7.5.x, JIRA is shipped with a new JDBC driver for Microsoft SQL Server.

Because of this change, the format of the file dbconfig.xml file needs to be changed (for example, the prefix of the database URL is now 'jdbc:sqlserver://')

The documentation [Connecting JIRA applications to SQL Server 2012|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver075/connecting-jira-applications-to-sql-server-2012-935390856.html] needs to be updated for Server 7.5 to reflect this change (the sample dbconfig.xml file needs to be updated as well in this documentation).
h3. Why this is important

If the dbconfig.xml file is not properly configured, customers can't connect to the MS SQL database. 
 It can be problematic when a customer upgrades from a version below 7.5 to 7.5.
h3. Workaround

For now, there is a KB that explains how to update the dbconfig.xml file [Updating JDBC URL for Microsoft SQL Server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/updating-jdbc-url-for-microsoft-sql-server-934718842.html]

h3. Workaround

No

fields.description:
Hi all,

I had recently to use project import and during the import from ZIP file I experienced the following error.
{quote}{{{color:red}There was a problem parsing the backup XML file at /var/atlassian*....zip. No 'issue' field for CustomFieldValue 'xxxxx'.{color}}}{quote}

I managed to edit *{{entries.xml}}* in the ZIP and remove node *{{CustomFieldValue}}* which had not attribue *{{issue}}*. Actually there were two instances - the import failed on the first one. After save and zipping, import accepted the new ZIP file and my data were restored. 

My queestion is why the "Integrity Checker" doesn't cover such cases? I personally see it as a pretty severe inconsistency. I was lucky that this happen on non Production instance, where is by the way such invalid record too. I am planning to remove it on prod by executing

{{DELETE FROM customfieldvalue WHERE issue IS NULL;}}

It would be really great if you can add the solution I took (unzip, XML edit, save) to your [Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/project-import-fails-with-no-issue-field-for-customfieldvalue-xxxx-293831070.html] to help others, of course it's valid and OK :). 

Optimally add such check to the "Integrity Checker" and let administrators fix it from the UI.

Thank you,
Jaroslav

PS: This doesn't change the fact that JIRA is the best tracking tool I worked with! Good job!
fields.summary: Extend the "Integrity Checker" for checking issue=NULL in customfieldvalue

fields.description:
h3. Summary


After creating filter query with label field equal to "" and using this filter as board's filter or after applying filter and refreshing list, error 500 is thrown.

h3. Steps to Reproduce - method 1

# Go to the issue navigator and save a filter with the following JQL:
labels = "" ORDER BY RANK ASC
# Go to a Scrum board's General configuration page and set that filter as the board's filter.
# From the very same board's General configuration page, click on the link Edit Filter Query. 
# On performing step 3, an error 500 will be thrown.

h3. Steps to Reproduce - method 2

# Go to the issue navigator and save a filter with the following JQL:
labels = "" ORDER BY RANK ASC, apply filter
# Refresh the page (F5)
# On performing step 2, an error 500 will be thrown.

h3. Expected Results
Both the issue list and the board with filter should show appropriate results.

h3. Actual Results 
Error 500 is thrown.

h3.Workaround
# Enter the filter directly through the Issue Navigator
# Remove labels = "" from your filter and save
fields.summary: Clicking on Edit Filter Query from board's General configuration page throws an internal server error (500)

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The $\{comment.id\} variable isn't replaced with the comments id when the webhook is triggered via post function and a comment is added during that transition

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create https://requestb.in/ then create webhook with relevant requestb.in URL and variable for example - https://requestb.in/1ldcb551?issuekey=${issue.key}&commentid=${comment.id}
# Check boxes for
#* Comment - created, updated
#* Worklog - created, updated
#* Issue - created, updated
# On a workflow for resolve or done, make sure there is a resolution screen with comment box, set the postfunction to trigger the webhook created
# Transition an issue to resolve/done with comments.

h3. Expected Results
The \{comment.id\} variable should be populated with the id of the comment added during the transition

h3. Actual Results
* commentid variable in requestb.in is empty upon transition
* only commenting on the issue (not transitioning) will populate the commentid with the ID.

h3.Workaround
No known workaround
fields.summary: Webhooks triggered in transition post function doesn't send comment id

fields.description:
Hi,

Creating this feature request for a vendor:

{quote}
The only recommended way for retrieving groups in Jira right now is via the GroupPickerSearchService.findGroups() method. This method takes a filter, but offers neither streaming nor pagination. Also, I couldn't find a way of getting the number of groups that exist without using this API.

In our case, this causes a somewhat significant slowdown of a couple of seconds per call in some enterprise customers' cases that use our app. I wouldn't call it urgent, but it's definitely less than optimal. And especially since we're focussing on the new Data Center program right now, we wanted to bring this to your attention.

BTW, Bitbucket (UserService.findGroups), Bamboo (BambooUserManager.getGroups) and Confluence (UserAccessor.getGroups) all have paged APIs for this (Didn't check fecru)
{quote}
fields.summary: Jira Server to offer a paged or streamed way for retrieving groups API
Indexing events improvements

fields.description: When viewing bugs in the "List View" format, left-clicking the issue key or title opens the bug within the context of the list, allowing you to go to the previous/next issues.  Middle clicking to open the bug in a new tab looses this context, and you can no longer navigate between issues.  Both of these use cases should allow the same behavior (ideally the former)
fields.summary: Inconsistent bug screen presentation when clicking links

fields.description:
As a Jira Administrator, it would be helpful if there was an option to deactivate users through Jira, even if they are coming from an LDAP directory.

An example use case, which isn't covered by revoking application access, is if I want to disable a Service Desk customer when the application is configured to allow access from everyone in Jira's user base.

Currently, the only way to cover that scenario is by making changes to Active Directory - like the user membership - and filtering out users not matching a user object filter.
fields.summary: Ability to deactivate LDAP users through Jira's user management
